website_summaries.verdict: Customers love this option for its ease of use and reliability.
pros: Very lightweight and fits comfortably in the hand
Gets praise for its reliable operation
Comes with two hex wrenches and replacement oil
cons: The safety latch on this option is a little large, which can make it difficult to know precisely where the staple is going when you squeeze the trigger

customer_reviews.title: This staple can do some work without jamming.
customer_reviews.text: I staple silk screens for 6 or 7 hours straight. This is a sturdy little gun and does its job without jamming hour after hour. Give it a drop of oil daily and you will get repaid many times over the cost. T50 staples do a great job holding the cloth on a silk screen becaust they are a wide head. I like this gun a lot!
customer_reviews.author: The WhistleSmith

customer_reviews.title: Boat Trailer Bunks
customer_reviews.text: I had the carpet coming loose on the bunks on my boat trailer. No wonder, they used zinc plated staples during the construction of the trailer. Over a period of time fishing salt water, the staples deteriorate. I have an old manual Arrow t50 stapler which would do the trick. With the amount of staples needed to do all the bunks, my wrist would be sore for a week. This stapler plus Arrow's 1/2" stainless steel staples did the trick. Sweet.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful! This stapler is slightly heavier than the manual ...
customer_reviews.text: At 72 my hands no longer tolerate extended use of any manual stapler. With 16 4 x 8 panels of screening to replace I knew I needed something less stressful. I purchased the pneumatic stapler in hopes it would help. Wonderful! This stapler is slightly heavier than the manual staplers I tried, but the balance and grip made up for that. Very comfortable! I started at 60 lbs. pressure and didn't get a flush penetration. 70 worked fine and has not torn through the screening. This Arrow pneumatic saved my hands and a lot of time. I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Works very well - nice product for the money
customer_reviews.text: i have only used it once and gone through a couple of hundred staples. I used arrow and stanley brand T50 in two different sizes. It never jammed, worked smoothly. I had no problem with the safety. It is very easy to load, just read the instructions. I used air tool oil prior to the first use and then afterwards. Good light duty stapler. I used it for stapling fence lattice.
customer_reviews.author: jimf

customer_reviews.title: Can't imagine doing the job without this stapler
customer_reviews.text: I used the stapler to reupholster 6 dining room chairs. That included piping and a dust cover. I probably used close to 1,000 staples. Trying to fold the material and pulling it tight with a manual stapler would have been next to impossible. The stapler worked flawlessly. I'm likely to take on more projects. If you have a tank compressor and a light weight hose you can go to it right away. A couple of drops of oil every couple of hours will keep it running smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Good pneumatic stapler.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this primarily for some re-upholstery projects where it worked great. Used with Arrow staples I had no problems with jams, feeding or misfires. It is small and easily handled and comes in a plastic case. The force it uses on the staples is easily managed by adjusting the pressure on the compressor used to power it, for my projects 90 psi seemed about right. This is good value pneumatic stapler.
customer_reviews.author: ckrug

customer_reviews.title: Too Many Jams and Couldn't fix
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an electric arrow stapler while covering a skin-on-frame kayak with heat-shrink 10 oz polyester fabric. It was much more powerful than the electric stapler, and no hammering of staples was required. However, on subsequent jobs it jammed frequently and then finally jammed and couldn't be cleared, even when the head was removed and cleaned it never worked properly again, and was finally junked, as the return period had expired. I would try another brand that uses the T-50 staples, as these are easily available, especially in stainless steel.
customer_reviews.author: Grafted-In

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan
customer_reviews.text: Did not work right out of the box. Spring mechanism that pushes the staples was broken. Tried for an hour to repair it as I had a project that needed to be done ASAP. Sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: TP

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and enough power - More for Construction than Upholstry
customer_reviews.text: a little heavier than my Surebonder. No problem driving 9/16 stainless staples through carpet. Safety action requires a little more force than necessary. Has a nice rubber tip on the safety to prevent marring. Not OILESS - requires a few drops of oil so you would not want to use on fabric.
customer_reviews.author: Wells Turnage

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: BOUGHT TO RECOVER MOTORCYCLE SEAT. BY THE TIME I WAS FINISHED, I HAD MORE THAN 50 PERCENT WASTED STAPLES DUE TO JAMS. THAT IS A LOT OF TIME AND CURSES TO CLEAR THEM ALL. THEN I HAD TO SWEEP AND BLOW OUT MY GARAGE TWICE TO PREVENT FLAT TIRES. JOB TOOK 3 TIMES LONGER THAN EXPECTED.
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT F.

customer_reviews.title: So much better than the electric one I've been using mostly because ...
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this stapler on a sofa and chair, So far it didn't have one hiccup and has no problem driving 3/8" staples through leather into hardwood. So much better than the electric one I've been using mostly because of the power but the length of the neck is good for hard to reach places.
customer_reviews.author: Danny U.

customer_reviews.title: I'd have better luck using this thing as a hammer.
customer_reviews.text: I'm experiencing about a 40% failure rate trying to drive Arrow T50 SS staplers into pine, using 65psi regulated air. Staples fail to feed, jam, or multiple staples fire. Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: M. Fred

customer_reviews.title: Junk!
customer_reviews.text: Received pneumatic staple gun already broken. Took it out loaded it with the correct staples and not even one fired. Going to consider this a loss because the cost to ship it back and 20% restock fee will make it even more worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: It's perfect - intuitive
customer_reviews.text: Bought to upholster a bench. It's perfect - intuitive, lightweight. at first I dind' thave enought pressure coming from the compressor so it didn't work. It wasn't hard to figure out what to do - at 75-80 PSI it worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: rik

customer_reviews.title: This stapler is perfect for replacing boat trailer bunks like others have already ...
customer_reviews.text: This stapler is perfect for replacing boat trailer bunks like others have already stated. Lots of power to seat staples with authority. Combined with the monel staples my trailer bunks should last a long time. Next project will be replacing the boat interior carpet, not looking forward to the difficult job but with this stapler it will go much easier. I highly recommend this stapler.
customer_reviews.author: Sagerider

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Several hundred staples in a boat seat project and not a single problem.
customer_reviews.author: Coeburn

customer_reviews.title: It is exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly like the one I had that quit working.. SO my staples I had on hand worked perfect and I was able to just take it out of the box and finish my project right away.
customer_reviews.author: sparkhurst

customer_reviews.title: Does the job much better than electric or manual stapler for installing boat trailer bunk material
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my first use to install new trailer bunk material on my kayyak storage rack. Used with a small portable air compressor hooked to a 300 watt inverter and had perfect power where there was an electrical outlet.
customer_reviews.author: Capt. J

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice, but that's about all.
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk. This unit could not sink staples consistently into 1/2 plywood. Every staple was folded or buckled. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Chromer

customer_reviews.title: good price doesnt last long
customer_reviews.text: good item good price. I like it in that it works with arrow staples that you can find anywhere. cheaper to buy this than buy repair parts for my BOSTITCH stapler that went DOA in one year. Update: died after 2-3 easy jobs. Changed fron 5 stars to 1
customer_reviews.author: handsomeman 57

customer_reviews.title: Be ready to clear jams
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing when it works. Know exactly where the staple will go and they end up driven all the way in. However, once in a while it breaks a staple and jams. Leg of the staple gets stuck between the striker and its housing so I have to open the loading mechanism and use pliers to move the striker with lots of force to clear the jam. If they made the thing with closer tolerance (striker just a tad wider), staple would have no space to jam into.Yes I am using Genuine Arrow staples!
customer_reviews.author: Sobriquet

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed!!!
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. Came jammed already and constantly jams. Appeared to be previously used
customer_reviews.author: Bryce N.

customer_reviews.title: worked fine
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to put down a carpet runner on my basement steps. Never missed, never jammed. I was surprised, I expected some jams. But it worked just fine.
customer_reviews.author: T-man

customer_reviews.title: best option
customer_reviews.text: Works great but started jamming after 4 dining room chairs. Took it apart and filed a surface that had a small lip on it causing them jam. But still way better than a manual gun. Still going strong after my minor rework. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Kontheadken

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Used over 5000 staples so far and it keeps reliably stapling. Very little miss feeds. I bought it to staple up insulation in a garage and basement.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Speck

customer_reviews.title: For being such an inexpensive tool it feels good in the hand performed perfectly straight out of the ...
customer_reviews.text: For being such an inexpensive tool it feels good in the hand performed perfectly straight out of the box I am more than happy with this purchase! There is nothing I would say I did not like about it the only thing I would suggest to purchasers of the staple gun know that you may need to adjust your air pressure depending upon which material you are stapling.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Makes manual and electric staplers suck more than they already do
customer_reviews.text: This staple gun makes me want to toss my manual and electric staplers but I will keep them around for those times when air isn't available or practical. I purchased this specifically to install snowmobile seat covers but it has also been used for the other tasks. Thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Just A Customer

customer_reviews.title: I guess this is your only choice for T-50 staples
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly the same item when compared to other brands - made in the same factory in China. This one replaces an identical Surebonder that failed to function after a few years of light duty. I hope that are some small improvements in this newer one.
customer_reviews.author: Charles H. Caban

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money! Didn't work out the box! Went to the company web site and followed their instruction to fix it but it didn't work. The problem is it shoots the first staple then nothing!! It must be a common problem cause of the fix on their web site!
customer_reviews.author: rodney morgan

customer_reviews.title: great value for the $$
customer_reviews.text: I use this often. Works great...light weight and powerful Shoot 1/2 staples into solid wood no problem
customer_reviews.author: Kristi  Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: Good tool
customer_reviews.text: Put it to work the day it arrived. Put up 4 bales of insulation in record time. Good tool. Advice: Make sure the staples are clean and straight. Any bad ones or excessive glue on the staples gum up the works. Also oil it when you're done, like it says.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic little tool!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and loading the staples it works great and very fast delivery it came days before it was due. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Marty R.

customer_reviews.title: I’ve needed a dependable stapler for covering my boat seats ...
customer_reviews.text: I’ve needed a dependable stapler for covering my boat seats, installing wire fence inside my private fence, tarring down screens on patio and many other hammer nail jobs finished in minutes with this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Merrill Yancey

customer_reviews.title: Working mans stapler
customer_reviews.text: If you have a lot of stabling and easy access to a small compressor these are a HUGE improvement over manual or electric staplers.
customer_reviews.author: CaptBob

customer_reviews.title: Great value, handy little stapler.
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this little stapler. We used it to hang the Tyvek on our house remodel and it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Short life expectancy
customer_reviews.text: Price reflects quality. My experience was much like others. The first time I used it to install batt insulation, it performed as expected and seldom mis-fired. But then some months later I tried using it and the strike blade would not fully return to the ready state. Disassembly, cleaning, lubricating did no good. Spend more money for better equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Perkmeister

customer_reviews.title: Great little stapler
customer_reviews.text: Great little stapler. I have used it to re upholster two of my Kawasaki quad seats and it drives the staples into the hard plastic real nice, just turn up the pressure to the max 200 p.s.i.
customer_reviews.author: Monty Arrington

customer_reviews.title: Shipped partially disassembled defective parts
customer_reviews.text: Stapler came with the safety device in pieces in a bag trying to put together bolt holes were stripped out at the factory must have been a return from the past
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product. Powerful but light weight
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Powerful but light weight. It did not come with a case, so I purchased a plastic case to fit it. Not having a case is the only negative thing regarding the product.
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: No adjustment.
customer_reviews.text: Works great but it does not have any adjustment for staple depth. You'll have to play around with the pressure to adjust your staple depth.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Jancso

customer_reviews.title: Bought it to recover dining room chairs and it worked great. Feels sturdy in the hand and easy to ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Bought it to recover dining room chairs and it worked great. Feels sturdy in the hand and easy to operate. It is easy to load staples. I would definitely recommend this especially at the low price.
customer_reviews.author: hgearle

customer_reviews.title: Great for fabric projects on stools ect
customer_reviews.text: This is slicker than snot!! Will shoot all the T-50 staples you have. Never jammed on me once. Great for fabric projects on stools ect.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Works better after modifications
customer_reviews.text: Stapler misfired and multi-fired more than it stapled correctly. I fiddled around with it and found the safety mechanism is junk. I removed the complete trigger safety and put a spacer under the trigger to allow it to fire. It works much better now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best staple gun I own.
customer_reviews.text: Forget manual stapler this is the best if you own a compressor hands down.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Good gun.
customer_reviews.text: Used this a few times for recovering some chairs with heavy vinyl. Did the trick, plenty of power. Beats those crap electric staplers by a long shot.
customer_reviews.author: BeerHat

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is an awesome little staple gun.
customer_reviews.author: LoneWolf63

customer_reviews.title: It appeared used when I received it
customer_reviews.text: The staple gun appeared used when I received it. Then did not work.
customer_reviews.author: C F

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for light project
customer_reviews.text: Mix feeling, it does work well when it's not jam with a broken staple, which unfortunately seems to happen often after 1h or so of use. Good buy for light project.
customer_reviews.author: Jenni

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works well and took a lot of effort out of hanging weather wrap on a shed I was building.
customer_reviews.author: Dan H

customer_reviews.title: Does not like low pressure
customer_reviews.text: It's a decent tool for the price but be careful as this tool will not work under 30 PSI.
customer_reviews.author: Mad_Matt1971

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: The right price for a much needed and useful tool. I highly reccommend.
customer_reviews.author: Clint

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Used this for reupholstering dining chair cushions. As expected, it had a few misfires and would shoot two staples at once after some of the misfires. Ran it through about 500 staples and am happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Did not work,
customer_reviews.text: I boughht this product last April 2019 and did not try to use it until recentley And it doe"s not work
customer_reviews.author: Bill Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Jury Still Out
customer_reviews.text: Jury is still out on this one. As usual, Amazon's service has been exceptional. Delivered on time, etc. The stapler is light and very comfortable to use. It is easy to load. I am insulating a 2500 SF house and just started the first room when the trigger return spring became dislodged. The gun will now fire in a "bump" mode if I keep certain things together as I hold it. In a couple of days my replacement gun will arrive and we will see if this is a fundamental design flaw or a one off malfunction of an incorrectly assembled tool.
customer_reviews.author: Wight Mann

customer_reviews.title: I have finally solve my problem once and for all ...
customer_reviews.text: I have finally solve my problem once and for all with this one.It works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: cindy cherry

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked so well the first time that I bought two more to give to friends
customer_reviews.author: Ed in Alaska

customer_reviews.title: Saves time and money
customer_reviews.text: It is the only way to put up Visqueen , or tyvek, or anything and it does it much quicker and no pain, love it
customer_reviews.author: James Seltenreich

customer_reviews.title: Arrow Staple Gun
customer_reviews.text: Nice handling staple gun. It feels nice in the hand. I haven't had any problems with staples getting jammed. My experience is that this is a reliable and trouble free stapler.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great.
customer_reviews.text: Slovenia this stapler. So much better than the Arrow manual stapler that i have used in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Wilson

customer_reviews.title: best yet
customer_reviews.text: great little stapler,lightweight and able to get in small areas. easy on hands and wrist price point was excellent
customer_reviews.author: catawba

customer_reviews.title: Great staple gun for the price
customer_reviews.text: Works great!!! Note: Staples go in the bottom not on top the slide.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a great staple gun for the price with a small air ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great staple gun for the price with a small air pump, you can do a lot of small jobs.
customer_reviews.author: solomon

customer_reviews.title: It works wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this stapler for 3 projects already since getting it! It works wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: Steve Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Best staple gun for the money
customer_reviews.text: Best staple gun for the money. Owned for over 2 years and has over 6 boxes of staples ran thru it with no feed issues.
customer_reviews.author: M. Rider

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good tool but you get what you pay for. Has a tendency to jam but an OK tool.
customer_reviews.author: bruce blomberg

customer_reviews.title: Great cost effective light duty stapler use it for stretching ...
customer_reviews.text: Great cost effective light duty stapler use it for stretching canvas and home projects (putting up insulation worked like a charm) 👌🏼
customer_reviews.author: Abigael Lewis

customer_reviews.title: ... the money it was a well built tool with easy to read instructions
customer_reviews.text: for the money it was a well built tool with easy to read instructions.it worked well in a small trial and it was easy to adjust the depth of the staple.
customer_reviews.author: joseph lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Great Bargain !
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding quality and easy to use. Very durable. Great bargain !

customer_reviews.title: Work great no problems so far and the 1/2 staples get ...
customer_reviews.text: Work great no problems so far and the 1/2 staples get driven right through the material and are fully seated so I'm happy
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Great Stapler!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and a nice addition to the tool box.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Gameon

customer_reviews.title: best one out there
customer_reviews.text: Awesome!!!! Love this thing.....screw doing it by hand. Only wish it came with a hard case
customer_reviews.author: Chad H.

customer_reviews.title: Good stapler. Works with no problems and has a ...
customer_reviews.text: Good stapler. Works with no problems and has a good heft but at the same time is not too heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Djac

customer_reviews.title: Best stapler for the money
customer_reviews.text: Way better than my dewalt that costs 10x as much
customer_reviews.author: Ivan Martinez

customer_reviews.title: rivet
customer_reviews.text: Rivet on handle broke during use. I fixed the problem and finished the job.
customer_reviews.author: HM

customer_reviews.title: Great stapler
customer_reviews.text: Great stapler, fast and no jams, I use this machine over 600 times and no jams.
customer_reviews.author: Doug B.

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time or money
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Used with 1/4" Arrow staples to install Tyvek wrap on the side of house. The recoil from the pneumatic head causes the staple compartment latch to release and dump all the staples on the ground. Multiple people tried using it and had the same experience. When it did stay closed, it often would not fire several times in a row and then it would shoot 2-4 staples at once all piled on top of one another. Tried different pressures but never got good results. It might work better in a horizontal orientation then vertical.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Don't know how I lived without it
customer_reviews.text: Love this stapler. Works perfect for power stapling. Made hanging my wife's class room a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This stapler worked flawlessly! I used it to install a new convertible top on my daughters Mustang.
customer_reviews.author: The Polymath Workshop

customer_reviews.title: Great little stapler!
customer_reviews.text: Had a little appolstering job to do but hands aren't strong enough for manual. This little tacker works great makes short work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This thing works great. It has a lot of power and works ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great. It has a lot of power and works so much better than electric or manual staplers.
customer_reviews.author: RTR

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I’m happy with this stapler arrived on time good product 👍👍👍
customer_reviews.author: Flip

customer_reviews.title: What a great experience. I was 18ft up on a ladder ...
customer_reviews.text: I used to put up insulation on my outdoor porch ceiling. What a great experience. I was 18ft up on a ladder (61 yrs. young), my first time using a Pneumatic tool, it was so easy I wish I had more things to staple...... :-)
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis Larson

customer_reviews.title: Go for it
customer_reviews.text: Good product....jams up on occasion but overall not a problem. Once you get the pressure dialed in it's smooth sailing
customer_reviews.author: Daniel R  Borsari

customer_reviews.title: Little loud yet reliable!
customer_reviews.text: A little bit louder than your average pneumatic nailer or stapler, but works like a charm. Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Seems good, to bad every brand I looked at is made in China.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked well fastening new atv seat cover to it's plastic base
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: One of the best tools, put up 3 ceilings with it, takes any size staple...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made gun, easy to load with one free hand. Drives well with minimal pressure. Buy a separate air-tool oil dispenser, the one that comes with this gun has no cap and is just a starter bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: staple gun
customer_reviews.text: I chose the Arrow PT50 for its ability to use 1/4 inch staples. Which was the length required to do my job. Very satisfied with this unit. It performed very well. I am well satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Larry J. Shaffer

customer_reviews.title: Sound product
customer_reviews.text: Pushed over a thousand staples through it and not a single misfire
customer_reviews.author: Doug H

customer_reviews.title: I would look for a better one next time
customer_reviews.text: Didn't get around to using this for the first month; first use--after about 25 staples, this jammed badly, tried to pick up 2 staples at once. still cannot remove one broken staple piece. 30 day warranty, ridiculous waste of $30 !!
customer_reviews.author: Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Received Used Item - Stapler Does Not Work
customer_reviews.text: Received used item. There were 8-10 staples loaded in gun. Oil bottle had hole in it covered with tape. Oil leaked all over. Stapler would only staple one out of every 20 or so tries. I can see why the previous owner returned it. Now I get to return it too. Thankfully, Amazon makes returns easy. (Nice little unit, too bad it didn't work.)
customer_reviews.author: Electric Man

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working After 1 DAY
customer_reviews.text: The gun worked OK for 1 day firing about 200 1/2" staples. For these 200 staples the gun misfired about 10% of the time. The next day misfires increased until it would only fire a staple 1 out of 20 times. Lubrication and different staples didn't fix the problem. I returned this and bought a 1/4"narrow crown stapler.
customer_reviews.author: T. Troxel

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a beast!
customer_reviews.text: This air stapler will drive standard T50 staples where a hand stapler cannot. I used this bad boy to re-cover a couple of Honda motorcycle seats to affix the upholstery to the plastic seat pan.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Newman

product_meta.title: Arrow Fastener Arrow PT50 Pneumatic Staple Gun
product_meta.description:
The Arrow PT50 delivers serious pneumatic tool performance at a price DIYers love. Packed with features like an easy-load magazine, over molded comfort grip, adjustable exhaust cover, and contact safety, this tool has the power and versatility to tackle any home project. And it’s capable of bump firing to speed big jobs along. PT50 comes with all necessary fittings and operates on home compressors up to 120psi. Works with T50 1/4-inch (6mm), 5/16-inch (8mm), 3/8-inch (10mm), 1/2-inch (12mm), 17/32-inch (13mm), and 9/16-inch (14mm).

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Arrow PT50 delivers serious pneumatic tool performance at a price DIYers love. Packed with features like an easy-load magazine, over molded comfort grip, adjustable exhaust cover, and contact safety, this tool has the power and versatility to tackle any home project. And it’s capable of bump firing to speed big jobs along. PT50 comes with all necessary fittings and operates on home compressors up to 120psi.
feature_bullets: Includes 2 hex wrenches and replacement oil
Great for construction and home repair projects
Easy bottom-load magazine for quick loading
